title: 24.4 Difference Constraints and Shortest Paths
content:
Section 24.4

Difference Constraints and Shortest Paths

Summary

Solving systems of difference constraints using Bellman-Ford.

Key Points

  • Difference constraint: xⱼ - xᵢ ≤ bₖ
  • Constraint graph: edge (i,j) with weight bₖ
  • Add source vertex s with 0-weight edges to all vertices
  • Run Bellman-Ford from s
  • Solution: xᵢ = δ(s, i) (shortest path distances)

Example

x₁ - x₂ ≤ 3, x₂ - x₃ ≤ -1. Build graph, run Bellman-Ford. Feasible iff no negative cycle.

Why It Matters

Scheduling, timing verification in circuits, temporal reasoning.
